title: Lesson 1
paragraph: People form many types of relationships during their lives. Family members, friends, colleagues and partners each play different roles, and meeting strangers or guests can lead to new connections. Respect and trust help maintain healthy relationships across generations.

words.meaning: a fully grown person
words.example: She became an adult at eighteen.

words.meaning: a parent's sister or sister-in-law
words.example: My aunt sent me a birthday card.

words.meaning: a male partner in a romantic relationship
words.example: Her boyfriend joined us for dinner.

words.meaning: a person you work with
words.example: I discussed the report with a colleague.

words.meaning: two people in a relationship or paired together
words.example: The couple walked along the beach.

words.meaning: a child of your aunt or uncle
words.example: My cousin lives in Osaka.

words.meaning: someone who buys goods or services
words.example: The customer asked for a refund.

words.meaning: a person invited to visit or stay
words.example: We prepared dinner for our guests.

words.meaning: a person living near you
words.example: My neighbour watered my plants while I was away.

words.meaning: a person you do not know
words.example: She asked a stranger for directions.

words.meaning: one of two children born at the same birth
words.example: The twins look very similar.

words.meaning: the time of being young; a young person
words.example: Many youths volunteered at the event.

words.meaning: a person or organization that hires people
words.example: The employer posted a new job opening.

words.meaning: a person hired to work for someone
words.example: The employee completed the task on time.

words.meaning: a person who works with or is in a relationship with you
words.example: They became business partners last year.

words.meaning: a person connected by blood or marriage
words.example: Many relatives came to the reunion.

words.meaning: a person in charge at work
words.example: The boss approved my vacation request.

words.meaning: a person traveling in a vehicle but not driving
words.example: The passenger fastened the seatbelt.

words.meaning: a person who visits a place
words.example: A visitor asked about the museum opening hours.

words.meaning: a person aged between 13 and 19
words.example: The teenager studied for exams all week.
